column1: Dimenhydrinate is a type of medicine called an antihistamine.
Dimenhydrinate is an ingredient found in some allergy medicines, as well as medicines used to treat nausea, vomiting, and seasickness.

Bladder and kidneys: - Inability to urinate Eyes, ears, nose, mouth, and throat: - Blurred vision - Dry mouth - Enlarged pupils - Severely dry eyes - Ringing in the ears Heart and blood vessels: - Low blood pressure - Rapid heartbeat Nervous system: - Agitation - Confusion - Convulsions (seizures) - Delirium - Depression - Drowsiness - Hallucinations - Increased sleepiness - Nervousness - Tremor - Unsteadiness Skin: - Dry, flushed, red skin
